reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is NOT a 5 star hotel, as I have stayed at 3 star hotels with better amenities and friendlier staffs! I just returned from a 3 night stay at this property, and I was completely dissappointed with every aspect of the hotel. In fact, the only positive thing I can say about the hotel is that it is a pretty building with some unique art and furnishings. Now for all the bad things:
reviews.title: Do not stay here!!

likes.disliked: — the rude staff and uncomfortable beds

reviews.text: 1. The staff: I have never encountered a more rude or snooty staff at a hotel. They never once greeted us, smiled at us, welcomed us, said good bye to us, etc. This was made all the more awkward because we had to walk past both the reception desk and concierge each time we entered or left the building. I have been fortunate enough to stay at many true 5 star hotels, so I am used to staff that are very friendly and welcoming - that even go out of their way to be welcoming. This is not that kind of place...
reviews.title: Don't waste your time, this is NOT a 5-star hotel!

likes.disliked: — everything other than the large room

reviews.title: 5* Mediocrity
reviews.text: 2. The rooms: Worst sheets I have ever slept on... they are so scratchy and they are pepto-bismol pink! Pillows are equally uncomfortable. The bathroom amenities are awful - the towels are small and threadbare, the hair dryer is from the 1960's and barely works, the only products provided are shampoo and shower gel - no lotion, conditioner, sewing kit, etc. Toilet paper was a joke.

3. Beach: Charge 15 Euros to use their "private" beach, that really anyone who pays that price can use. For the amount of money this hotel charges for rooms I would expect free beach access... or at least discounted.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: 4. Location: While this hotel is located on the main beach promenade, it is at the very end of town, and all of the fun action in Nice is at least a 10 minute walk (or a 25 minute walk to Old Town, which is where all of Nice's charm is). Even if the hotel had been fabulous, I would stay somewhere more central on my next trip to Nice. Taxis are very expensive in Nice too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is a magnificent one-off; it occupies an enviable sea-front position; it contains many art treasures and much character -- but, oh dear, oh dear, the facilities are so faded and out of date that one wonders what the owners of this hotel can be thinking of.
reviews.title: Once is Enough

reviews.text: If you enjoy turn of the (nineteenth) century plumbing, lighting, bedding (blankets!) and just about every other faded facility in the rooms (and yes they really do have single sheets of lavatory paper which would be an embarassment in a 2 star boarding house!) then this is the place for you.

Mixed review
reviews.text: We experienced a four night stay at the Negresco. The location of the hotel is excellent. We had a sea view room, which enabled us to sit and look at the sea, however it was so noisy. As with most mediterranean countries, mopeds are popular but they werent popular with me when they kept me awake and then when I did drop off to sleep, they awoke me at 6am.

reviews.title: Great art, ancient showers, appalling value!
reviews.text: I have to say, I am amazed at the incredible reviews this hotel receives. I truly accept the hotel is an historical landmark and holds some fascinating artifacts however it claims to be a 5 star luxury hotel and I really am at a loss to understand how the rooms could have attained this status. Maybe in the 1950's they were luxurious but I am pretty sure the room we stayed in has not been updated since the 1950's. The carpet was disgusting. It was a "pooey" brown colour and was "sticky" underfoot. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillow was a large square shape not much thicker than a tablemat. The bedcover was something you would normally find in a grotty guesthouse. The wall covering was silk however it was so faded. The curtains were like something sold in Ikea, thin. As were the bath towels. They were like drying yourself with sandpaper. I had a real laugh when my husband put on his dressing gown - It looked as though he was wearing a childs one it was so small.

reviews.title: Exceptional Experience at hotel Negresco
reviews.text: The room was only cleaned once, we were forgotten twice. Never bothered to complain, too English I guess.
The turn down service arrived at 10 pm one night - bit too late.
